subject: Language Arts
topic: Poetry: Understanding Elements of Poetry (Rhyme, Rhythm, Stanza)
title: The Magic of Words: Exploring Poetry
learningObjectives: Identify and define key elements of poetry: rhyme, rhythm, and stanza.
Recognize figurative language in poems (similes, metaphors).
Analyze how the elements of poetry work together to create meaning and feeling.

content.body: Poetry is a special kind of writing that uses the power of words to make us feel and think. Poets use tools like rhyme, rhythm, and stanzas to create their magic.

content.alt: Icons representing rhyme (two rhyming words), rhythm (musical notes), and a stanza (a group of lines).

content.body: Rhyme is when words have the same ending sound. Rhythm is the beat or pattern of a poem. A stanza is a group of lines in a poem, like a paragraph in a story.

questions.question: What is a stanza in a poem?
options: A single line of a poem
A group of lines in a poem
questions.correctAnswer: A group of lines in a poem

es.title: La Magia de las Palabras: Explorando la Poesía

content.body: La poesía es un tipo especial de escritura que usa el poder de las palabras para hacernos sentir y pensar. Los poetas usan herramientas como la rima, el ritmo y las estrofas para crear su magia.

questions.question: ¿Qué es una estrofa en un poema?
options: Una sola línea de un poema
Un grupo de líneas en un poema
